com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class TextEditorInputMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.TextEditorInputMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInputMode

    public class TextEditorInputMode
extends Object
implements IInputMode
    A simple IInputMode that displays a TextArea instance in the CanvasControl to let the user edit a text.

    Hitting escape or enter will cancel or stop editing.

    This mode is Exclusive by default.

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Type Property and Description
      StringProperty editorText
      Gets the current text property of the text input editor.

      • getAnchor

        public final IPoint getAnchor()
        Gets the anchor of the text box.

        The anchor is the point inside the coordinate system of the text box that shall coincide with the Location in the world coordinate system. The X and Y values are expressed as relative width/height ratios.

        Returns:
        The Anchor.
        See Also:
        setAnchor(IPoint)

      • getCancelRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getCancelRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer to detect when editing the text shall be canceled.

        When the provided KeyEventArgs are recognized, cancel() is called.

        Returns:
        The cancel recognizer. The default recognizer checks for KeyCode.ESCAPE.
        See Also:
        getLineBreakRecognizer(), getStopRecognizer(), setCancelRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getInputModeContext

        public final IInputModeContext getInputModeContext()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Returns the context instance this mode is currently installed in or null if this instance is not installed.

        Note that this instance should not be passed down to subordinate modes or instances. Instead a corresponding context that has this instance set as the ParentInputMode should be used.

        Specified by:
        getInputModeContext in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The InputModeContext.

      • getLineBreakRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getLineBreakRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer to detect the key gesture for new line breaks.

        When the provided KeyEventArgs are recognized, a new line break is inserted at the current curret position.

        Returns:
        The line break recognizer. The default recognizer checks for KeyCode.ENTER while ModifierKeys.SHORTCUT is pressed.
        See Also:
        getCancelRecognizer(), getStopRecognizer(), setLineBreakRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getLocation

        public final IPoint getLocation()
        Gets the location of the text box in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        The Location.
        See Also:
        setLocation(IPoint)

      • getMaximumZoom

        protected double getMaximumZoom(SizeD textBoxSize)
        Determines the text box's maximum zoom value. If the canvas zoom value is greater than this threshold, the text box keeps the size for this maximum value and does not grow further.

        By default, the text box zoom is limited to a value smaller than 3 or a dynamic threshold if the size of the text box would otherwise occupy a significant amount of space in the editor. Override and return Double.MAX_VALUE to effectively switch off the maximum zoom threshold.

        Parameters:
        textBoxSize - The size of the text box to display.
        Returns:
        The maximum zoom factor the text box should be scaled to.

      • getMinimumZoom

        protected double getMinimumZoom(SizeD textBoxSize)
        Determines the text box's minimum zoom value. If the canvas zoom value is lesser than this threshold, the text box keeps the size for this minimum value and does not shrink any further.

        By default, the text box zoom is limited to a value greater than 0.1 or a font size greater than 8 if the zoom is taken into account. Override and return Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY to effectively switch off this minimum zoom threshold.

        Parameters:
        textBoxSize - The size of the text box to display.
        Returns:
        The minimum zoom factor the text box should be scaled to.

      • getPriority

        public final int getPriority()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Specified by:
        getPriority in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The Priority.

      • getStopRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getStopRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer to detect when editing the text shall be stopped.

        When the provided KeyEventArgs are recognized, stop() is called.

        Returns:
        The stop recognizer. The default recognizer checks for KeyCode.ENTER while ModifierKeys.SHORTCUT is not pressed.
        See Also:
        getLineBreakRecognizer(), getCancelRecognizer(), setStopRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getTextBox

        public final TextInputControl getTextBox()
        Gets the text box to use for displaying and editing. This will trigger the com.yworks.yfiles.input.TextEditorInputMode#createTextBox() factory method to create the instance to use during one editing. The same instance is then used for future text editing until #setTextBox(javafx.scene.control.Control) is called with a different instance.
        Returns:
        The TextBox.
        See Also:
        #setTextBox(javafx.scene.control.Control)

      • getTextBoxBounds

        protected RectD getTextBoxBounds()
        Returns the bounds of the TextBox.

      • getUpVector

        public final IPoint getUpVector()
        Gets the point that describes the "up"-vector that will be used to determine the orientation of the text box in the world coordinate system.

        The default is 0, -1.

        Returns:
        The UpVector.
        See Also:
        setUpVector(IPoint)

      • install

        public void install(IInputModeContext context,
                    ConcurrencyController controller)
        Installs this mode into the given context that is provided by the canvas.

        In general a mode can only be installed into a single canvas at all times.

        This method is called to initialize this instance. Subclasses should override this method to register the corresponding event handler delegates for the various input events they need to register with.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation, first.

        Specified by:
        install in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context that this instance shall be installed into. The same instance will be passed to this instance during IInputMode.uninstall(IInputModeContext). A reference to the context may be kept and queried during the time the mode is installed.
        controller - The Controller for this mode.
        See Also:
        IInputMode.uninstall(IInputModeContext)

      • installTextBox

        protected void installTextBox()
        Installs the text box in the canvas and puts focus into it.

      • isAutoCommittingOnFocusLostEnabled

        public final boolean isAutoCommittingOnFocusLostEnabled()
        Gets a property that determines whether the text edited should be committed if the focus gets lost or the editing should be canceled.

        The default behavior is to cancel the editing process.

        Returns:
        The AutoCommittingOnFocusLostEnabled.
        See Also:
        setAutoCommittingOnFocusLostEnabled(boolean)

      • isAutoFlippingTextBoxEnabled

        public final boolean isAutoFlippingTextBoxEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether to automatically flip the orientation of the text box if the UpVector actually points downwards.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if the text box should be flipped if necessary; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setAutoFlippingTextBoxEnabled(boolean)

      • isAutoFocusingCanvasOnEditorClosedEnabled

        public final boolean isAutoFocusingCanvasOnEditorClosedEnabled()
        Gets a property that determines whether this mode should try to Node.requestFocus() the Canvas once the editor is closed via a keyboard gesture.

        The default is true

        Returns:
        The AutoFocusingCanvasOnEditorClosedEnabled.
        See Also:
        setAutoFocusingCanvasOnEditorClosedEnabled(boolean)

      • isAutoStartEditingEnabled

        public final boolean isAutoStartEditingEnabled()
        Determines whether this mode should automatically fire up the editor once it gets installed.

        If this mode is permanently installed, set this flag to false and set the Editing flag to true in order to start editing.

        Returns:
        The AutoStartEditingEnabled.
        See Also:
        setAutoStartEditingEnabled(boolean)

      • isEditing

        public final boolean isEditing()
        Gets the current editing state of the editor.

        Setting a new value will trigger the onBeginEditing() and onCancelEditing() methods respectively.

        Returns:
        The Editing.
        See Also:
        setEditing(boolean)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Gets the enabled state of this input mode.

        Clients can use this property to disable or reenable this instance. This will set the Enabled property of the installed Controller so a disabled instance should never try to acquire the input mutex.

        Returns:
        The Enabled.
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • isExclusive

        public final boolean isExclusive()
        Gets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        Returns:
        The Exclusive.
        See Also:
        setExclusive(boolean)

      • onBeginEditing

        protected void onBeginEditing()
        Called when editing starts.

        Requests the input mutex, and installs the text box.

      • onCanceled

        protected void onCanceled()
        Called after cancel() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been canceled.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • onCancelEditing

        protected void onCancelEditing()
        Called when editing gets canceled.

        Removes the text box and releases the input mutex.

      • onConcurrencyControllerActivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerActivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to true.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been activated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

      • onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to false.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been deactivated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

      • onEditingCanceled

        protected void onEditingCanceled(TextEventArgs args)
        Raises the EditingCanceled event.
        Parameters:
        args - The event argument

      • onEditingStarted

        protected void onEditingStarted(TextEventArgs args)
        Raises the EditingStarted event.
        Parameters:
        args - The event argument.

      • onStopEditing

        protected void onStopEditing()
        Called when editing is stopped.

        Triggers the TextEdited event, removes the box and releases the input mutex.

      • onStopped

        protected void onStopped()
        Called after stop() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been stopped.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • onTextEdited

        protected void onTextEdited(TextEventArgs args)
        Raises the TextEdited event.
        Parameters:
        args - The event arguments.

        public final void setLineBreakRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)

      • setPriority

        public final void setPriority(int value)
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Parameters:

        getPriority()

      • showInViewCoordinates

        protected boolean showInViewCoordinates(SizeD textBoxSize)
        Determines whether the text box should be displayed in the view coordinate system instead of in the world coordinate system.

        If enabled, the zoom value used to scale the text box is 1. Otherwise, the zoom value is determined by the zoom level of the CanvasControl limited by the values returned by the methods getMinimumZoom(SizeD) and getMaximumZoom(SizeD).

        Parameters:
        textBoxSize - The size of the text box to display.
        Returns:
        Whether to show it in the view coordinate system. The default implementation always returns false.
        See Also:
        getMinimumZoom(SizeD), getMaximumZoom(SizeD)

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Stops editing and returns true.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        base.Stop()
        See Also:
        IInputMode.cancel()

      • uninstall

        public void uninstall(IInputModeContext context)
        Uninstalls this mode from the given context.

        This code should clean up all changes made to the canvas in the IInputMode.install(IInputModeContext, ConcurrencyController) method. After a mode has been uninstalled it can be installed again into the same or another canvas.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation after their own code.

        Specified by:
        uninstall in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context to deregister from. This is the same instance that had been passed to IInputMode.install(IInputModeContext, ConcurrencyController) during installation.

      • uninstallTextBox

        protected void uninstallTextBox()
        Called to remove the text box from the application. The default implementation removes the node from the scene graph and requests focus on the CanvasControl.
